abstract: Swiss Re said General Electric would divest its stake, worth about 3.5 billion Swiss francs ($2.9 billion), selling half to Swiss Re and placing the other half in the market. Swiss Re had waived a lock-up period on the shares, which General Electric had received as part of the payment for its reinsurance units, which it sold for $7.4 billion to the Swiss reinsurer last year.
lead_paragraph: Swiss Re said General Electric would divest its stake, worth about 3.5 billion Swiss francs ($2.9 billion), selling half to Swiss Re and placing the other half in the market. Swiss Re had waived a lock-up period on the shares, which General Electric had received as part of the payment for its reinsurance units, which it sold for $7.4 billion to the Swiss reinsurer last year.

headline.main: G.E. to Sell $2.9 Billion Swiss Re Stake
